ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla

Interface LibraryAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileSystemAdapter, MediaAdapter

    public interface LibraryAdapter
extends android.widget.ListAdapter
    Provides support for limiters and a few other methods LibraryActivity uses for its adapters.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DATA_EXPANDABLE
      Extra for row data: if true, row has expander arrow.
      static java.lang.String DATA_FILE
      Extra for row data: canonical file path.
      static java.lang.String DATA_ID
      Extra for row data: media id.
      static java.lang.String DATA_TITLE
      Extra for row data: media title.
      static java.lang.String DATA_TYPE
      Extra for row data: media type.
      static long HEADER_ID
      Special id for DATA_ID: the row represented is a header view.
      static long INVALID_ID
      Special id for DATA_ID: invalid id.

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

    • Field Detail

      • DATA_ID

        static final java.lang.String DATA_ID
        Extra for row data: media id. type: long.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEADER_ID

        static final long HEADER_ID
        Special id for DATA_ID: the row represented is a header view.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INVALID_ID

        static final long INVALID_ID
        Special id for DATA_ID: invalid id.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_TITLE

        static final java.lang.String DATA_TITLE
        Extra for row data: media title. type: String.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_TYPE

        static final java.lang.String DATA_TYPE
        Extra for row data: media type. type: int. One of MediaUtils.TYPE_*.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_FILE

        static final java.lang.String DATA_FILE
        Extra for row data: canonical file path. type: String. Only present if type is MediaUtils.TYPE_FILE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_EXPANDABLE

        static final java.lang.String DATA_EXPANDABLE
        Extra for row data: if true, row has expander arrow. type: boolean.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getMediaType

        int getMediaType()
        Return the type of media represented by this adapter. One of MediaUtils.TYPE_*.

      • setLimiter

        void setLimiter(Limiter limiter)
        Set the limiter for the adapter. A limiter is intended to restrict displayed media to only those that are children of a given parent media item.
        Parameters:
        limiter - The limiter, created by buildLimiter(long).

      • getLimiter

        Limiter getLimiter()
        Returns the limiter currently active on this adapter or null if none are active.

      • buildLimiter

        Limiter buildLimiter(long id)
        Builds a limiter based off of the media represented by the given row.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the row.
        See Also:
        getLimiter(), setLimiter(Limiter)

      • setFilter

        void setFilter(java.lang.String filter)
        Set a new filter. The data should be requeried after calling this.
        Parameters:
        filter - The terms to filter on, separated by spaces. Only media that contain all of the terms (in any order) will be displayed after filtering is complete.

      • query

        java.lang.Object query()
        Retrieve the data for this adapter. The data must be set with commitQuery(Object) before it takes effect. This should be called on a worker thread.
        Returns:
        The data. Contents depend on the sub-class.

      • commitQuery

        void commitQuery(java.lang.Object data)
        Update the adapter with the given data. Must be called on the UI thread.
        Parameters:
        data - Data from query().

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear the data for this adapter. Must be called on the UI thread.

      • createData

        android.content.Intent createData(android.view.View row)
        Creates the row data used by LibraryActivity.
